meanings.definition: In the direction from which the wind is blowing.
meanings.sent1: The leaves rustled upwind as the wind blew gently.
meanings.sent2: The sailor adjusted the sail to go upwind towards the shore.
meanings.sent3: The kite flew upwind, surprising everyone with its speed.
meanings.sent4: The scent of fresh flowers wafted upwind, filling the air with sweetness.
meanings.sent5: The birds soared upwind effortlessly, carried by the breeze.

meanings.definition: Moving or situated in the direction from which the wind is blowing.
meanings.sent1: The upwind side of the house felt cooler in the summer heat.
meanings.sent2: The upwind location was perfect for flying kites on a windy day.
meanings.sent3: The upwind tree stood tall, its branches swaying gracefully in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The upwind boat sailed smoothly, cutting through the water with ease.
meanings.sent5: The upwind hill provided a great view of the valley below.
